homepage.49: I've been wandering through the inbrain courses for a long time, because there is a very valuable opportunity to try the free part in order to understand whether you want to do it or not. The critical thinking course is the first course that I completely completed. I very happy with my decision to take this course.The way of presenting the material is very effective in my opinion.

LessonFirst.3: Site pages are assembled from elements, like a LEGO constructor. Text blocks, pictures, links, buttons are all elements of the site. Elements are described in HTML. Any web page contains code in this language and is saved in an HTML file .When you open a website, it is the HTML file that is loaded into the browser first.
LessonFirst.4: An HTML file is just a text file with a .html extension. But what's written in an HTML file is not a list of groceries or life notes, but HTML code.
LessonFirst.5: To understand how HTML works, let's look at an example. Here is a button with a label. Click on it to go further:
LessonFirst.7: And here is the code that describes this button. If you write it in an HTML file, such a button will appear on the site:
LessonFirst.10: You must have noticed the constructions with angle brackets - these are HTML tags. Tags describe site elements. For example, the <button> tag describes a button.
LessonFirst.11: Most often tags are paired. Opening tag
LessonFirst.12: says: «Here the button starts» and the closing
LessonFirst.15: will be displayed on the button.
